summary: Sea urchins are small, spiny sea creatures with round shells, found in oceans worldwide. They move slowly using tube feet and eat algae and other slow animals. Their predators include sea otters and starfish. With over 950 species, they have five-way symmetry as adults and two-way symmetry as larvae. Sea urchins have been studied for their unique biology and are used in aquariums to control algae. Fossil urchins are even considered good luck charms!
title: Sea urchin
